Oyakata holds session:
On Mon, 4 Oct 2004 20:04:45 -0700 (PDT), W. Field$B$5$s(B wrote:
>
>
>I know Okubo, Toshimichi(1830$BK(B8) was Japanese
>statesman and a major figure in the Meiji restoration.
>I am trying to find out the names of his parents and
>his kids. Maybe what family crest is used. Anything
>more on the genealogy side would help me out a lot.
>Thanks a bunch.
>
Okubo Toshimichi $BBg5WJ]MxDL(B
September 26, 1830 - May 14, 1878
(Date of birth was August 10 in the calendar which was in use at the 
time)
Given name was Toshinari$B!!Mx:Q(B

Father:
Okubo Jiemon Toshiyo
$BBg5WJ]<!1&1RLgMx@$(B

Mother:
Minayoshi Fukuko
$B3'5H$U$/;R(B

Married (1857):
Hayasaki Masuko
$BAa:jK~<w;R(B

Children: 5 boys and one girl
$BMxOB(B Toshikazu, inherited leadership of the family at first; had no 
male children
$B?-82(B Nobuaki; adopted by Makino family; Count Makino Nobuaki
$BMxIp(B Toshitake; governor of Tottori, Ooita, Saitama, and Oosaka at 
various times; took over leadership of the family
$BMxIW(B Toshio; fairly unknown; died young
$BM:7'(B Yuukuma; adopted by Toshimichi's sister's husband's family the 
Ishihara
$BK';R(B: Only daughter; famously comforted her just before being 
assassinated by taking her for a horse buggy ride on the day of his 
assassination.

Hope that helps a little. Let me know if it brings up follow-up 
questions.

--
